Package org.eclipse.mosaic.rti.api

Interface FederateAmbassador

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<FederateAmbassador>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFederateAmbassador, AbstractNetworkAmbassador, AbstractSumoAmbassador, ApplicationAmbassador, CellAmbassador, EnvironmentAmbassador, LibSumoAmbassador, MappingAmbassador, Ns3Ambassador, OmnetppAmbassador, OutputAmbassador, SnsAmbassador, SumoAmbassador, SumoGuiAmbassador
    public interface FederateAmbassador
extends Comparable<FederateAmbassador>
    This interface must be implemented by each simulator (federate) that wants to be included into a federation. It contains methods that are used by the RTI services to start, stop and control the federate.

    • Method Detail

      • createFederateExecutor

        @Nonnull
FederateExecutor createFederateExecutor​(String host,
                                        int port,
                                        CLocalHost.OperatingSystem os)
        Returns a FederateExecutor which is used to start the federate this ambassador is associated with. If no separate federate needs to be started, a NopFederateExecutor should be returned.
        Parameters:
        host - name of the host (as specified in /etc/hosts.xml)
        port - port number to be used by this federate
        os - the current operating system of the system
        Returns:
        the FederateExecutor which starts the federate

      • createDockerFederateExecutor

        DockerFederateExecutor createDockerFederateExecutor​(String dockerImage,
                                                    CLocalHost.OperatingSystem os)
                                             throws UnsupportedOperationException
        If the federate or simulator can be executed as a docker container, this method returns a DockerFederateExecutor.
        Parameters:
        dockerImage - name of the docker image containing the federate (as specified in /etc/defaults.xml)
        os - the current operating system of the host machine
        Returns:
        the DockerFederateExecutor which starts the federate
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the ambassador does not support running the federate in a docker container.

      • connectToFederate

        void connectToFederate​(String host,
                       InputStream in,
                       InputStream err)
                throws InternalFederateException
        This method is called by the federation management service after it has started the corresponding federate or simulator.
        Parameters:
        host - The host on which the simulator is running.
        in - This input stream is connected to the output stream of the started simulator process. The stream is only valid during this method call.
        Throws:
        InternalFederateException - This exception is to be thrown when a federation specific error occurs.

      • connectToFederate

        void connectToFederate​(String host,
                       int port)
        This method is called by the federation management service to connect to the federate without starting it. This requires the port to be configured in the configuration file for the RTI.
        Parameters:
        host - the host on which the simulator is running
        port - the port to use for connecting to the simulator

      • setRtiAmbassador

        void setRtiAmbassador​(@Nonnull
                      RtiAmbassador rti)
        Assigns a new RtiAmbassador to this federate. The RtiAmbassador is the bridge the the RTI providing various methods, e.g. to exchange interactions. Each ambassador requires its own instance of the RtiAmbassador.
        Parameters:
        rti - a RtiAmbassador instance

      • initialize

        void initialize​(long startTime,
                long endTime)
         throws InternalFederateException
        This method is called by the TimeManagement to tell the federate the start and the end time.
        Parameters:
        startTime - Start time of the simulation run in nano seconds.
        endTime - End time of the simulation run in nano seconds.
        Throws:
        InternalFederateException - This exception is to be thrown when a federation specific error occurs.

      • advanceTime

        void advanceTime​(long time)
          throws InternalFederateException
        This method is called by the time management service. If the ambassador has requested to advance its internal clock, the time management service calls this method to signal that a time advance request is granted.
        Parameters:
        time - Time in nano seconds until this federate is allowed to advance its internal clock.
        Throws:
        InternalFederateException - This exception is to be thrown when a federation specific error occurs.

      • receiveInteraction

        void receiveInteraction​(@Nonnull
                        Interaction interaction)
                 throws InternalFederateException
        The receiveMessage method is called by the time management service when an interaction is available for which this federate is registered. If the receiver wants to advance its internal clock based on the interaction it has to request a time advance. The receiver is not allowed to advance its internal clock without granted request.
        Parameters:
        interaction - An object extending the interaction object and containing shared data by another federate.
        Throws:
        InternalFederateException - This exception is to be thrown when a federation specific error occurs.

      • finishSimulation

        void finishSimulation()
               throws InternalFederateException
        This method is called by the time management service to signal that the simulation is finished.
        Throws:
        InternalFederateException

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns the identifier of the federate.

      • setFederateDescriptor

        void setFederateDescriptor​(@Nonnull
                           FederateDescriptor descriptor)
        Sets the descriptor containing all required information for setting up the ambassador and federate.

      • getPriority

        byte getPriority()
        Returns the priority of this ambassador/federate. The lower the value the higher the priority.
        Returns:
        The priority of this federate

      • isTimeConstrained

        boolean isTimeConstrained()
        Returns whether this federate is time constrained. Is set if the federate is sensitive towards the correct ordering of events. The federate ambassador will ensure that the message processing happens in time stamp order. If set to false, interactions will be processed will be in receive order.
        Returns:
        true if this federate is time constrained, else false

      • isTimeRegulating

        boolean isTimeRegulating()
        Returns whether this federate is time regulating. Is set if the federate influences other federates and can prevent them from advancing their local time.
        Returns:
        true if this federate is time regulating, false else
